snippet: Rising tourism and a steady stream of attempted Monday visits have led the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s director, Thomas P. Campbell, to propose opening every day of the week.
abstract: Metropolitan Museum of Art, which began closing on Mondays in 1971 in order to save money, is considering opening seven days a week; says rising tourism has brought so many potential new visitors that the economic balance may have changed.
lead_paragraph: Rising tourism and a steady stream of attempted Monday visits have led the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s director, Thomas P. Campbell, to propose opening every day of the week.
